result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Court reduced JusticePoint supervision to LEVEL 4. Court ordered random drug testing and breathalyzers. All other previously ordered conditions of bail remain in full effect.

Defendant Theodore Grant Dutton III appeared by video.  Attorney Christopher Lee Hartley appeared by video for Theodore Grant Dutton III.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for bail/bond hearing.  Court found the State has complied with victim notification law.  Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Case adjourned for plea/sentencing in Branch 40.  This matter will be held in person in Room 634 of the Courthouse.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 19, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Received and Filed:  Treatment verification letter.

Defendant Theodore Grant Dutton III appeared by video.  Attorney Christopher Lee Hartley appeared by video for Theodore Grant Dutton III.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests a bail/bond hearing date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40. This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties. This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/a8cc2343-9b62-c309-778f-fa846faecb6a.

Defendant Theodore Grant Dutton in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Theodore Grant Dutton appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver

Received and Filed.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No driving without a valid license.
Court orders defendant TO JUSTICE POINT for supervision. Defendant to report to JUSTICE POINT LEVEL 5 immediately upon leaving court. 
IF THE DEFENDANT FAILS TO REPORT A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Theodore Grant Dutton in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Theodore Grant Dutton not in court.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 2/4/22 @ 2p
